cards.name: Abu Ja'far
cards.text: When Abu Ja'far dies, destroy all creatures blocking or blocked by it. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Active Volcano
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target blue permanent.
• Return target Island to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Akron Legionnaire
cards.text: Except for creatures named Akron Legionnaire and artifact creatures, creatures you control can't attack.

cards.name: Aladdin
cards.text: {1}{R}{R}, {T}: Gain control of target artifact for as long as you control Aladdin.

cards.name: Angelic Voices
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 as long as you control no nonartifact, nonwhite creatures.

cards.name: Arcades Sabboth
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Arcades Sabboth unless you pay {G}{W}{U}.
Each untapped creature you control gets +0/+2 as long as it's not attacking.
{W}: Arcades Sabboth gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Arena of the Ancients
cards.text:
Legendary creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
When Arena of the Ancients enters the battlefield, tap all legendary creatures.

cards.flavor: After the rape of Argoth Forest during the rule of the artificers, the Pixies of Argoth bent their magic to more practical ends.
cards.name: Argothian Pixies
cards.text:
Argothian Pixies can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Argothian Pixies by artifact creatures.

cards.name: Ashnod's Altar
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Ashnod found few willing to trade their humanity for the power she offered them.
cards.name: Ashnod's Transmogrant
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Ashnod's Transmogrant: Put a +1/+1 counter on target nonartifact creature. That creature becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.

cards.name: Axelrod Gunnarson
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Axelrod Gunnarson this turn dies, you gain 1 life and Axelrod deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Ayesha Tanaka
cards.text:
Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
{T}: Counter target activated ability from an artifact source unless that ability's controller pays {W}. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)

cards.flavor: The Azure Drake would be more powerful were it not so easily distracted.
cards.name: Azure Drake
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: Some say Banshees are the hounds of Death, baying to herd their prey into the arms of their master.
cards.name: Banshee
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Banshee deals half X damage, rounded down, to target creature or player, and half X damage, rounded up, to you.

cards.flavor: For a dozen years the Cage had held Lord Ith, but as the Pretender Mairsil's power weakened, so did the bars.
cards.name: Barl's Cage
cards.text: {3}: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.flavor: Bogardan is a land as volatile as the creatures who live there.
cards.name: Beasts of Bogardan
cards.text:
Protection from red
Beasts of Bogardan gets +1/+1 as long as an opponent controls a nontoken white permanent.

cards.flavor: Heavy light flooded across the landscape, cloaking everything in deep crimson.
cards.name: Blood Moon
cards.text: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.

cards.flavor: The willow knows what the storm does not: that the power to endure harm outlives the power to inflict it.
cards.name: Blood of the Martyr
cards.text: Until end of turn, if damage would be dealt to any creature, you may have that damage dealt to you instead.

cards.flavor: Their stench was vile and strong enough, but not nearly as powerful as their hunger.
cards.name: Bog Rats
cards.text: Bog Rats can't be blocked by Walls.

cards.name: Book of Rass
cards.text: {2}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: "O! call back yesterday, bid time return." —William Shakespeare, King Richard the Second
cards.name: Boomerang
cards.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Bronze Horse
cards.text:
Trample
As long as you control another creature, prevent all damage that would be dealt to Bronze Horse by spells that target it.

cards.flavor: These stealthy felines have survived so many battles that some believe they must possess many lives.
cards.name: Cat Warriors
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.name: Chromium
cards.text:
Flying
Rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Chromium unless you pay {W}{U}{B}.

cards.name: City of Brass
cards.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Cocoon
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
When Cocoon enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature and put three pupa counters on Cocoon.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during your untap step if Cocoon has a pupa counter on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a pupa counter from Cocoon. If you can't, sacrifice it, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature, and that creature gains flying.

cards.name: Concordant Crossroads
cards.text: All creatures have haste.

cards.flavor: Harthag gave a jolly laugh as he surveyed the army before him. "Ho ho ho! Midgets! You think you can stand in my way?"
cards.name: Craw Giant
cards.text:
Trample
Rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)

cards.name: Cuombajj Witches
cards.text: {T}: Cuombajj Witches deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to target creature or player of an opponent's choice.

cards.name: Cyclone
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a wind counter on Cyclone, then sacrifice Cyclone unless you pay {G} for each wind counter on it. If you pay, Cyclone deals damage equal to the number of wind counters on it to each creature and each player.

cards.name: D'Avenant Archer
cards.text: {T}: D'Avenant Archer deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.flavor:
"My power is as vast as the plains; my strength is that of mountains. Each wave that crashes upon the shore thunders like blood in my veins."
—Dakkon Blackblade, Memoirs
cards.name: Dakkon Blackblade
cards.text: Dakkon Blackblade's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.

cards.name: Dance of Many
cards.text:
When Dance of Many enters the battlefield, create a token that's a copy of target nontoken creature.
When Dance of Many leaves the battlefield, exile the token.
When the token leaves the battlefield, sacrifice Dance of Many.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Dance of Many unless you pay {U}{U}.

cards.name: Dandân
cards.text:
Dandân can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Dandân.

cards.flavor: D'Haren stared at the twisted lump of metal that had been a prized artifact. The fight was getting ugly.
cards.name: Divine Offering
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.flavor:
"Flittering, wheeling,/ darting in to strike, and then/ gone just as you blink."
—"Dragonfly Haiku," poet unkown
cards.name: Emerald Dragonfly
cards.text:
Flying
{G}{G}: Emerald Dragonfly gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Enchantment Alteration
cards.text: Attach target Aura attached to a creature or land to another permanent of that type.

cards.name: Erhnam Djinn
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target non-Wall creature an opponent controls gains forestwalk until your next upkeep. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.name: Fallen Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Feldon found the first of these canes frozen in the Ronom Glacier.
cards.name: Feldon's Cane
cards.text: {T}, Exile Feldon's Cane: Shuffle your graveyard into your library.

cards.name: Fire Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Fire Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.flavor: Then the maiden bade him cast off his robes and cover his body with fishliver oil, that he might safely follow her into the sea.
cards.name: Fishliver Oil
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has islandwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

cards.flavor: Many people say that no power can bring the mountains low. Many people are fools.
cards.name: Flash Flood
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target red permanent.
• Return target Mountain to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: The Fountain had stood in the town square for centuries, but only the pigeons knew its secret.
cards.name: Fountain of Youth
cards.text: {2}, {T}: You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Gabriel Angelfire
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, choose flying, first strike, trample, or rampage 3. Gabriel Angelfire gains that ability until your next upkeep. (Whenever a creature with rampage 3 becomes blocked, it gets +3/+3 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)

cards.name: Gauntlets of Chaos
cards.text: {5}, Sacrifice Gauntlets of Chaos: Exchange control of target artifact, creature, or land you control and target permanent an opponent controls that shares one of those types with it. If those permanents are exchanged this way, destroy all Auras attached to them.

cards.name: Ghazbán Ogre
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player has more life than each other player, the player with the most life gains control of Ghazbán Ogre.

cards.name: Giant Slug
cards.text: {5}: At the beginning of your next upkeep, choose a basic land type. Giant Slug gains landwalk of the chosen type until the end of that turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a land of that type.)

cards.name: Goblin Artisans
cards.text: {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, draw a card. If you lose the flip, counter target artifact spell you control that isn't the target of an ability from another creature named Goblin Artisans.

cards.flavor: "From down here we can make the whole wall collapse!" "Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"
cards.name: Goblin Digging Team
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.

cards.flavor: "I knew it weren't no ordinary pile of—you know." —Norin the Wary
cards.name: Goblin Shrine
cards.text:
Enchant land
As long as enchanted land is a basic Mountain, Goblin creatures get +1/+0.
When Goblin Shrine leaves the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to each Goblin creature.

cards.name: Goblins of the Flarg
cards.text:
Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
When you control a Dwarf, sacrifice Goblins of the Flarg.

cards.name: Hasran Ogress
cards.text: Whenever Hasran Ogress attacks, it deals 3 damage to you unless you pay {2}.

cards.flavor: You might leave here, Chenndra, should another take your place . . . .
cards.name: Hell's Caretaker
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.flavor: "A blast, an echo . . . then silence."
cards.name: Horn of Deafening
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.

cards.flavor: Theodar strode the battle lines, snatching swords with his bare hands and casting them aside until all cowered before him.
cards.name: Indestructible Aura
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

cards.flavor: The elite guard of the Mesa High Priests, the Ivory Guardians were created to protect the innocent and faithful.
cards.name: Ivory Guardians
cards.text:
Protection from red
Creatures named Ivory Guardians get +1/+1 as long as an opponent controls a nontoken red permanent.

cards.flavor: This timeworn relic was responsible for many of Urza's victories, though he never fully comprehended its mystic runes.
cards.name: Jalum Tome
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Jeweled Bird
cards.text:
Remove Jeweled Bird from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
{T}: Ante Jeweled Bird. If you do, put all other cards you own from the ante into your graveyard, then draw a card.

cards.name: Johan
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may have Johan gain "Johan can't attack" until end of combat. If you do, attacking doesn't cause creatures you control to tap this combat if Johan is untapped.

cards.name: Juxtapose
cards.text: You and target player exchange control of the creature you each control with the highest converted mana cost. Then exchange control of artifacts the same way. If two or more permanents a player controls are tied for highest cost, their controller chooses one of them.

cards.flavor: And then the Archangel Anthius spoke to them, saying, "Fear shall be vanquished by the Sword of Faith."
cards.name: Keepers of the Faith
Kei Takahashi
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

cards.name: Land's Edge
cards.text: Discard a card: If the discarded card was a land card, Land's Edge deals 2 damage to target player. Any player may activate this ability.

cards.flavor: Though it affords excellent protection, few don this armor. The process is uncomfortable and not easily reversed.
cards.name: Living Armor
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Living Armor: Put X +0/+1 counters on target creature, where X is that creature's converted mana cost.

cards.flavor: Marhault Elsdragon follows a strict philosophy, never letting emotions cloud his thoughts. No chance observer could imagine the rage in his heart.
cards.name: Marhault Elsdragon
cards.text: Rampage 1 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)

cards.name: Metamorphosis
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Metamorphosis, sacrifice a creature.
Add X mana of any one color to your mana pool, where X is one plus the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost. Spend this mana only to cast creature spells.

cards.flavor: The Yeti's single greatest asset is its unnerving ability to blend in with its surroundings.
cards.name: Mountain Yeti
cards.text:
Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
Protection from white

cards.name: Nebuchadnezzar
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Name a card. Target opponent reveals X cards at random from his or her hand. Then that player discards all cards with that name revealed this way. Activate this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: Nicol Bolas
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Nicol Bolas unless you pay {U}{B}{R}.
Whenever Nicol Bolas deals damage to an opponent, that player discards his or her hand.

cards.flavor: The Battle of Tomakul taught Urza not to rely on fickle reinforcements.
cards.name: Obelisk of Undoing
cards.text: {6}, {T}: Return target permanent you both own and control to your hand.

cards.name: Palladia-Mors
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Palladia-Mors unless you pay {R}{G}{W}.

cards.name: Petra Sphinx
cards.text: {T}: Target player names a card, then reveals the top card of his or her library. If that card is the named card, that player puts it into his or her hand. If it isn't, the player puts it into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Primordial Ooze
cards.text:
Primordial Ooze attacks each turn if able.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Primordial Ooze. Then you may pay {X}, where X is the number of +1/+1 counters on it. If you don't, tap Primordial Ooze and it deals X damage to you.

cards.name: Puppet Master
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to its owner's hand. If that card is returned to its owner's hand this way, you may pay {U}{U}{U}. If you do, return Puppet Master to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Rabid Wombat
cards.text:
Vigilance
Rabid Wombat gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.

cards.flavor: Urza was the first to understand that the war would not be lost for lack of power, but for lack of troops.
cards.name: Rakalite
cards.text: {2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. Return Rakalite to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Recall
cards.text: Discard X cards, then return a card from your graveyard to your hand for each card discarded this way. Exile Recall.

cards.flavor: Nethya stiffened suddenly, head cocked as if straining to hear some distant sound, then fell lifeless to the ground.
cards.name: Remove Soul
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.

cards.flavor:
"For my confession they burned me with fire
And found that I was for endurance made."
—The Arabian Nights, trans. Haddawy
cards.name: Repentant Blacksmith
cards.text: Protection from red

cards.flavor: "Many are in high place, and of renown: but mysteries are revealed unto the meek." —Ecclesiasticus 3:19
cards.name: Revelation
cards.text: Players play with their hands revealed.

cards.name: Rubinia Soulsinger
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Rubinia Soulsinger during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as you control Rubinia and Rubinia remains tapped.

cards.name: Runesword
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target attacking creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. When that creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Runesword. If the creature deals damage to a creature this turn, the creature dealt damage can't be regenerated this turn. If a creature dealt damage by the targeted creature would die this turn, exile that creature instead.

cards.name: Safe Haven
cards.text:
{2}, {T}: Exile target creature you control.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice Safe Haven. If you do, return each card exiled with Safe Haven to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.flavor: String, weapons, wax, or jewels—it makes no difference. Leave nothing unguarded in Scarwood.
cards.name: Scavenger Folk
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Sentinel
cards.text: {0}: Change Sentinel's base toughness to 1 plus the power of target creature blocking or blocked by Sentinel. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.name: Serpent Generator
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Snake artifact creature token. It has "Whenever this creature deals damage to a player, that player gets a poison counter." (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

cards.name: Shield Wall
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"When churchyards yawn and hell itself breathes out/ Contagion to this world."
—William Shakespeare, Hamlet
cards.name: Shimian Night Stalker
cards.text: {B}, {T}: All damage that would be dealt to you this turn by target attacking creature is dealt to Shimian Night Stalker instead.

cards.flavor: Even the brave have cause to tremble at the sight of Sivitri Scarzam. Who else has tamed Scarzam's Dragon?
cards.name: Sivitri Scarzam
Sol'kanar the Swamp King
cards.text:
Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
Whenever a player casts a black spell, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Stangg
cards.text: When Stangg enters the battlefield, create a legendary 3/4 red and green Human Warrior creature token named Stangg Twin. When Stangg leaves the battlefield, exile that token. When that token leaves the battlefield, sacrifice Stangg.

cards.name: Storm Seeker
cards.text: Storm Seeker deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.

cards.name: Takklemaggot
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -0/-1 counter on that creature.
When enchanted creature dies, that creature's controller chooses a creature that Takklemaggot could enchant. If he or she does, return Takklemaggot to the battlefield under your control attached to that creature. If he or she doesn't, return Takklemaggot to the battlefield under your control as a non-Aura enchantment. It loses "enchant creature" and gains "At the beginning of that player's upkeep, Takklemaggot deals 1 damage to him or her."

cards.name: Teleport
cards.text:
Cast Teleport only during the declare attackers step.
Target creature can't be blocked this turn.

cards.flavor: Magic often masters those who cannot master it.
cards.name: The Fallen
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, The Fallen deals 1 damage to each opponent it has dealt damage to this game.

cards.name: The Wretched
cards.text: At end of combat, gain control of all creatures blocking The Wretched for as long as you control The Wretched.

cards.flavor: Administrator of the military state of Sheoltun, Tobias Andrion is the military right arm of the empire and the figurehead of its freedom.
cards.name: Tobias Andrion
Tor Wauki
cards.text: {T}: Tor Wauki deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.flavor: The dark opening seemed to breathe the cold, damp air of the dead earth in a steady rhythm.
cards.name: Tormod's Crypt
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Tormod's Crypt: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"You know what I was,/ You see what I am: change me, change me!"
—Randall Jarrell, The Woman at the Washington Zoo
cards.name: Transmutation
cards.text: Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.

cards.name: Triassic Egg
cards.text:
{3}, {T}: Put a hatchling counter on Triassic Egg.
Sacrifice Triassic Egg: Choose one —
• You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only if two or more hatchling counters are on Triassic Egg.
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only if two or more hatchling counters are on Triassic Egg.

cards.name: Vaevictis Asmadi
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Vaevictis Asmadi unless you pay {B}{R}{G}.

{R}: Vaevictis Asmadi gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Voodoo Doll
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a pin counter on Voodoo Doll.
At the beginning of your end step, if Voodoo Doll is untapped, destroy Voodoo Doll and it deals damage to you equal to the number of pin counters on it.
{X}{X}, {T}: Voodoo Doll deals damage equal to the number of pin counters on it to target creature or player. X is the number of pin counters on Voodoo Doll.

cards.flavor: At a distance, we mistook the sound for a waterfall . . . .
cards.name: Wall of Heat
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)

cards.flavor: Like so many obstacles in life, the Wall of Opposition is but an illusion, held fast by the focus and belief of the one who creates it.
cards.name: Wall of Opposition
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}: Wall of Opposition gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wall of Shadows
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Wall of Shadows by creatures it's blocking.
Wall of Shadows can't be the target of spells that can target only Walls or of abilities that can target only Walls.

cards.flavor: "Walls of a castle are made out of stone,/ Walls of a house out of bricks or of wood./ My walls are made out of magic alone,/ Stronger than any that ever have stood." —Chrysoberyl Earthsdaughter, Incantations
cards.name: Wall of Vapor
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Wall of Vapor by creatures it's blocking.

cards.flavor: So confusing is the Wall's appearance that few of its victims even see it move.
cards.name: Wall of Wonder
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{2}{U}{U}: Wall of Wonder gets +4/-4 until end of turn and can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.

cards.flavor:
"When elephants fight it is the grass that suffers."
—Kikuyu proverb
cards.name: War Elephant
cards.text: Trample; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

cards.name: Witch Hunter
cards.text:

cards.name: Yawgmoth Demon
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you don't, tap Yawgmoth Demon and it deals 2 damage to you.
